content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is an example of how you can implement this in Julia:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Find all code blocks
    code_blocks = collect.(eachmatch(r"```julia(.*?)```", md, seed=1))
    
    # Remove code fences and join the code blocks with a newline
    joined_code = reduce((a, b) -> string(a, "\n", b), map(x->replace(x[2], "`" => ""), code_blocks))
    
    return joined_code
end
```
This function uses regular expressions to find all the Julia language code blocks in the markdown document. It then removes the code fences and joins them together with a newline. The `reduce` function is used to concatenate all the code blocks into one string. 

Please note that this solution assumes that there are no nested or mixed code blocks (e.g., an HTML block within a Julia block). If your input can have such cases, you would need a more complex solution.
